page.title: 05HEALTH AND HEALTH SERVICES
page.content:
With a good inspection system at schools for children, child health is reasonably good in all respects, although it remains to be seen as to long-term health, in view of our contemporary consumption of large quantities of junk and convenience foodstuffs.
Infant and adult health remains reasonable, although this may arise more from generally better health experienced amongst rural people, since access to hospitals (Penrith and Carlisle) and doctors' surgeries is not easy. Our survey showed the following distances from home to doctor for varying percentages of residents: 6%-5miles; 23%-6miles; 12%- 7miles; 29%-8miles; 12%-9miles; 6%-10miles; 6%-12miles.
